alert.note: Alert for Caddo; Comanche; Grady (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 11 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Comanche, Grady and southeastern Caddo Counties through 700 PM CDT... At 630 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Amber to near Sterling. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chickasha, Blanchard, Tuttle, Rush Springs, Fletcher, Cyril, Sterling, Alex, Verden, Cement, Amber, Bridge Creek, Pocasset, Norge, Bradley, Agawam, Middleberg, Tabler, Ninnekah, and Acme. This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 59 and 101. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
